Richard,
My best guess is that maybe it was easier to raise the rim from a thin sheet and the second sheet w/o cup rim was added for extra thickness.    ?

Laminations aside, I have seen both flat cup guards like this and ones that are hemispherical like some European guards.  Oddly any of these that I've seen mounted or with hitsuana have had the convex side toward the tsuka, in the opposite orientation of a European guard.   

Jim



  Hi Jim and Gordon, this is the reply from the owner

  It's rather like a saucer. Flat on the other side, with the rim turned up. No detail at all on this side.

  Rich
